item.title: Washington prepares for major protest
item.description: Protesters are expected to gather in Washington for a huge demonstration as US street marches over the killing of an African-American man in custody enter a 12th day.

item.title: 20,000 Sydneysiders rally for black lives
item.description: Nothing was going to stop 20,000 Sydneysiders rallying for Aboriginal rights but an appeal court's last-minute approval certainly helped.

item.title: Melbourne protest organisers to cop fine
item.description: Police will fine Melbourne Black Lives Matter rally organisers $1652 each for breaching the directions of the chief health officer, as thousands turned out to call for an end to Aboriginal deaths in custody.

item.title: Thousands turn out in Aust day of protest
item.description: Tens of thousands of people have rallied across Australia in support of the Black Lives Matter movement and to protest Aboriginal deaths in custody, defying calls from health officials and the prime minister to stay home amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Thousands demand justice at Brisbane rally
item.description: Thousands of people have flocked to inner-city Brisbane to protest police brutality against indigenous Australians and call for justice for those who have died in custody.

item.title: Unity the key at peaceful Adelaide march
item.description: Unity and anti-violence were key themes of a peaceful Black Lives Matter rally in Adelaide as protesters passionately had their say during a show of solidarity.

item.title: Twitter, Facebook review Trump posts
item.description: A video posted by Donald Trump's 2020 election campaign -- decrying civil unrest in the wake of the killing of George Floyd -- has been removed by Twitter, citing a copyright-infringement claim.

item.title: Melbourne man positive with virus in Qld
item.description: A Melbourne man was infectious with COVID-19 when he flew to Bundaberg via Brisbane for a fruit picking job this week.

item.title: Politicians fret over protests’ virus risk
item.description: Federal politicians are treading a delicate line of supporting freedom of speech while raising concerns about the health risks of Black Lives Matter rallies across the country during a pandemic.

item.title: Pangolin given highest protection in China
item.description: China is ordering its highest level of protection for the armadillo-like pangolin as part of its crackdown on the wildlife trade following the global coronavirus pandemic.
